summary: The Empowering and Enforcing Environmental Justice Act of 2025 seeks to establish an Office of Environmental Justice within the Department of Justice. The bill defines environmental justice, mandates the creation of a Senior Advisory Council, and outlines the duties of the Office, including developing strategies, coordinating environmental justice matters, and administering a grant program for state, local, and tribal governments. The grant program aims to improve their capacity to enforce environmental laws related to environmental justice matters.
